title: Audio - Tap Behavior in EPG - Entitled User
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user entitled to MLB Audio content and viewing the audio EPG
custom_steps: WHEN I tap on a game that has an available media feed
custom_expected:
THEN the feed for that game should begin playing according to the feed selection logic, accounting for my favorite team, language, and home/away status

NOTE- Feed selection logic is as follows
Play the first audio feed available for the game I’ve selected, based on this hierarchical list:

Favorite team’s feed in my device’s language

Home team’s feed in my device’s language

Away team’s feed in my device’s language

Favorite team’s feed, regardless of language

Home team’s feed, regardless of language

Away team’s feed, regardless of language

title: Scoreboard card cells
custom_preconds:
Turn on Talkback

https://support.google.com/accessibility/android/answer/6283677?hl=en
custom_steps:
When selecting a scoreboard card cell, read out a full description of the game.

General Notes:

For TalkBack, ERA (earned run average) should be read as “E.R.A.” This is to avoid TalkBack saying “era”, like “end of an era”.

*PREGAME*

Notes:

- Spell out time zones (“Mountain Time”, “Pacific Time”, etc)

- If the game was postponed, replace start time with “postponed”

||| Template | Examples
|| awayTeam versus homeTeam, game starts at gameStartTime --- Probable pitchers: awayTeamName pitcher awayTeamPitcher, awayTeamPitcherWins and awayTeamPitcherLosses, awayTeamPitcherERA, homeTeamName pitcher homeTeamPitcher, homeTeamPitcherWins and homeTeamPitcherLosses | ---Standard--- “Yankees versus Blue Jays, game starts at 7:05 PM eastern time. Probable pitchers, Yankees pitcher Smith, 10 and 5, 3.05 E.R.A.. Blue Jays Pitcher Johnson, 5 and 20, 4.11 E.R.A.” ---TBD Pitcher---  “Yankees versus Blue Jays, game starts at 7:05 PM eastern time. Probable pitchers: Yankees pitcher TBD. Blue Jays pitcher Johnson, 5 and 20, 4.11 E.R.A.” ---Postponed--- “Yankees versus Blue Jays, game postponed.” ||

LIVE

Notes:

- If the game is tied, change to: awayTeam versus homeTeam, game is tied awayTeamRuns to homeTeamRuns.

- If a game is suspended, ignore batter/pitcher info and append the following  to the score: “game is suspended.”

||| Template | Examples
|| awayTeam versus homeTeam, gameState winningTeam leads winningTeamRuns to losingTeamRuns. ---Pitching---:  pitcherName, pitcherInningsPitched innings pitched pitcherERA E.R.A. ---Batting---: batterName batterHitTotal and batterAtBatTotal. batterBattingAverage batting average.| Standard “Yankees versus Blue Jays. Top 3. Yankees lead, 3 to 0. Pitching: Bradley, 3.1 innings pitched, 3.15 ERA. Batting: Wilson, 0 and 2, .326 batting average.” Tie Game “Yankees versus Blue Jays. Bottom 4. Game is tied 0 to 0. Pitching: Bradley, 3.1 innings pitched, 3.15 ERA. Batting: Wilson, 0 and 2, .326 batting average.” Mid-Inning “Yankees versus Blue Jays. Middle 6. Game is tied 0 to 0.”  Suspended. “Yankees versus Blue Jays. Game suspended. Yankees lead, 3 to 2.”

FINAL

Notes:

- If a game did not end in 9 innings, append the total innings to the game state — gameState inningTotal innings

||| Template | Examples
|| awayTeam versus homeTeam, gameState. winningTeam won, winningTeamScore to losingTeamScore. The winning pitcher was winningPitcherName, winningPitcherWins and winningPitcherLosses record with a winningPitcherERA E.R.A.  The losing pitcher was losingPitcherName, losingPitcherWins and losingPitcherLosses record with a losingPitcherERA E.R.A. The save pitcher was savePitcherName withsavePitcherSaves saves and a savePitcherERA E.R.A.  | **Win-Loss-Save**. “Yankees versus Blue Jays, final. Yankees won 2 to 0. The winning pitcher was Wheeler. 5 and 3 record with a 2.15 ERA. The losing pitcher was Kershaw. 10 and 3 record with 3.11 ERA. The save pitcher was Neris with 10 saves and a 1.12 ERA.”  **Non-Standard Inning Total**. “Yankees versus Blue Jays, final 11 innings. Yankees won 2 to 0. The winning pitcher was Wheeler. 5 and 3 record with a 2.15 ERA. The losing pitcher was Kershaw. 10 and 3 record with 3.11 ERA.”

title: Talkback Behavior during Audio Scrubber
custom_steps:
As an accessibilty user, when I interact with the scrubber, I would like it to read back information about its state.

Scrubber - Archive

When scrubber is released (touchup), the following copy should be read aloud:

First, say: ”Adjustable: Media Position:”

Then, say:

“[Y Minutes], [Z Seconds]”, where the time read is the time the user is at since broadcast start

Scrubber - Archive

*When scrubber is released (touchup), the following copy should be read aloud:

 

First, say: ”Adjustable: Media Position:”

Then, say:

If the user is at the start of the broadcast, say “start of broadcast”

If the user is at a point that is not the beginning, say: “[Y Minutes], [Z Seconds]”, where the time read is the time the user is at since broadcast start

Technical Notes / Concerns
* Media playing over talkback
* Test on Legacy for Priority (Archive Games - MLB.tv)
* iOS - possibly baseline
* Best Effort to help user navigate - redesign would be ideal
* Timebox to 5 points for navigation

**LIVE**

title: SVOD/VOD Playback on Mobile

title: Favorite Teams (Automated)
custom_preconds:
As a user going through the onboarding process, after I pass through the Welcome Screen, I must be able to select my one (1) favorite team and any number of teams to follow.

- A favorite team is the first team selected by the user. A user's Favorite team will be given elevated status throughout the app. A user may only have one favorite team
- Followed teams are any additional team the user chooses to select. A user may choose to follow as many teams as they like. Followed teams will have secondary priority throughout the app
- A user must have a favorite team to enable followed teams
- A user may choose not to set any favorite or followed teams
- Display different text based on if selecting fresh or re-setting saved data.

GIVEN a user
WHEN I am going through onboarding
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I must be able to select a favorite team

GIVEN a user going through onboarding
WHEN I have selected a favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I must be able to select one or more teams to follow

custom_steps_separated.content:

custom_steps: WHEN I select to watch a game that is live
custom_expected: THEN I must be shown that specific MLB.TV stream for the stream that was selected

title: Live Playback Controls
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user
custom_steps: WHEN I watch MLB.TV live content
custom_expected: THEN I must have access to a scrubber, forward 10s/back 10s, closed captioning, chromecast, live, and feed selector buttons from the player

title: Archive Playback
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user with a valid MLB.TV entitlement
custom_steps: WHEN I select to watch a game that has been completed previously and an archive feed is available
custom_expected: THEN I must be shown the MLB.TV archive stream for that game

title: Archive Playback Controls
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user
custom_steps: WHEN I watch MLB.TV archive content
custom_expected: THEN I must have access to a scrubber, forward 10s/back 10s, closed captioning, chromecast, fullscreen, and feed selector buttons from the player in both landscape and portrait mode

title: Volume Control
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user
custom_steps: WHEN I watch MLB.TV content
custom_expected: THEN I must be able to change the volume of the content using my device’s hardware buttons

title: Keep Device Display from Automatically Turning Off
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN MLB.tv content is actively playing
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN my device’s display must not turn off automatically

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN MLB.tv content is paused
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN my device’s display may turn off based on my device settings

title: Device Display Manually Turned Off While Viewing
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user
custom_steps:
WHEN MLB.tv content is actively playing
AND I manually turn off my device’s display
custom_expected: THEN the MLB.TV content must be paused

title: Scrubber
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I watch MLB.TV content
AND I tap a specific point on the scrubber
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video should begin playing the content from that point in time

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I watch MLB.TV content
AND I tap and hold the active state indicator on the scrubber
AND I scroll back in time
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video should rewind as I scroll back

title: Feed Picker
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I watch MLB.TV content
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I must be able to change the video feed for the game I am watching

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I watch MLB.TV content

AND I change the video feed using the feed picker
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video must continue from the same point in time prior to when I switched

title: Alt Audio
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user watching MLB.TV content

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I open the feed picker
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I must be presented with the available audio feed options

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I select a new audio feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the audio feed should be changed without impacting the video feed

NOTE: Alternate radio feeds do not always start at the same time as the video feed, so it is possible that the alternate audio will be silent at the beginning of a video broadcast. As long as the alternate audio is available later in the feed, this should be considered to be working as expected.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I select a new video feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the audio feeds available to me in the feed picker should change

title: Live: Live Button
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user watching a live MLB.TV broadcast

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am not currently “caught up” to a live point in the broadcast
AND I tap the Live Button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be advanced to the “Live” point of the current broadcast

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I am currently “caught up” to a live point in the broadcast
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Live button state should Indicate I am currently live

title: Forward 10/Back 10
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user watching MLB.TV content

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I tap the forward 10s button
AND I am not currently at a live point in the broadcast
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be taken 10 seconds forward

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I tap the forward 10s button
AND I am fewer than 10s behind Live
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be taken to live

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I tap the backwards 10s button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be taken 10 seconds backwards

title: Play/Pause
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user watching MLB.TV content

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the content is currently playing
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the play/pause button should indicate “Pause”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the content is currently paused
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the play/pause button should indicate “Play”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I tap the Pause button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the content should pause
AND the paused video should remain visible on screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I tap the Play button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the content should play

title: Landscape/Portrait Rotation
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user watching MLB.TV content

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am watching MLB.TV in Portrait

AND I rotate my device to the left or right
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video player should change to Landscape

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am watching MLB.TV in Landscape

AND I rotate my device to the left or right
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video player should change to Portrait

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am watching MLB.TV in Portrait

AND I tap the full screen button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video player should change to Landscape

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am watching MLB.TV in Landscape

AND I tap the full screen button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video player should change to Portrait

title: Landscape: Zoom In
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user watching MLB.TV in Landscape mode
custom_expected: I double tap the player

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I double tap the player
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video should zoom in so that it fills the entire width of my device

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN Landscape mode is zoomed in

AND I double tap the player
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video should zoom out to its original state

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN Landscape mode is zoomed in

AND  I rotate my device back to Portrait mode
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video should zoom out to its original state

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I am watching live MLB.TV content
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see a live indicator on the right side of the screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I am watching archive or live MLB.TV content
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see an indicator on the right side of the scrubber telling me the duration of the broadcast I am currently viewing.

custom_steps:
WHEN I launch MLB.TV

custom_expected: THEN show MLB.TV with the dark theme.

title: Single Button Feed Selection Logic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user entitled to MLB TV content
custom_steps: WHEN I tap on a TV button on a game that has an available media feed
custom_expected:
THEN the feed for that game should begin playing according to the feed selection logic, accounting for my favorite team, language, and home/away status
AND the feed should begin playing from the appropriate point based on whether it is live or archive content 

FEED SELECTION LOGIC NOTE- Play the first TV feed available for the game I’ve selected, based on this hierarchical list:

Favorite team’s feed in my device’s language

Home team’s feed in my device’s language

Away team’s feed in my device’s language

Favorite team’s feed, regardless of language

Home team’s feed, regardless of language

Away team’s feed, regardless of language

title: Concurrency Cap
custom_steps:
GIVEN a user is in the app
WHEN a user plays a stream on 5 different devices
AND then attempts to play a stream on a 6th device after waiting 5 minutes
THEN the 5th device should display an error to the effect of there being too many concurrent streams on the account.

title: Single Team user- broadcast optoins
custom_preconds: GIEVN a single team entitled user
custom_steps:
WHEN the user plays a game to which they are entitled to view the feed for their single team
AND another feed exists to which they are not entitled
AND the user selects the broadcast options (TV icon)
custom_expected:
THEN the user does not have the option to change to the alternate video feed to which they are not entitled
AND the user does have the option to choose alternate audio feeds for the video feed which they are already watching and to which they are entitled

EXAMPLE:
This user is only entitled to the BAL feed and not the PHI feed
![](index.php?/attachments/get/13637158)

title: Broadcast Options- entitled to all
custom_preconds: GIVEN an entitled user

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user selects a game 
AND playback begins
AND the user selects the broadcast options (TV icon)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN alternate video feeds are available (except if it is a single national feed ie Apple TV+, Peacock, ESPN, etc.)
AND alternate audio feeds are available

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects an alternate audio feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN alternate audio plays
AND the video continues from the same point which the user was viewing

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects an alternate video feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the other video feed plays from the same point which the user was viewing the game on the other feed
AND new alternate audio is displayed which corresponds to the newly selected video

title: Playback using Mobile Data with wifi turned off
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an entitled user with mobile data available
AND wifi is turned off
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects a game to play
custom_expected: THEN the game should play back smoothly and without interruption

title: Feed selection logic
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a an entitled user
(NOTE: the feed selection logic is highly dependent on the user's choice of favorite and followed teams in the settings menu, and can also be effected by the device language settings. Please pay close attention to the requirements for each individual test case)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN  a user attempts to watch a game where one of the teams is their favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN open the favorite team’s feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user attempts to watch a game where one of the teams is a followed team 
AND the other team is not their favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN open the followed team’s feed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user attempts to watch a game where they follow both teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN open the feed of the higher priority team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN  a user attempts to watch a game where they don’t follow or favor either team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN open the feed for the home team 
OR 
IF no home team feed is available THEN open the away feed.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN  the device language is Spanish 
AND a Spanish language feed is available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN pick the Spanish feed with Spanish audio
Otherwise default to English

title: Game resume behaviors
custom_preconds: GIVEN an entitled user

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN starting a live game 
AND the user does not have hide spoilers active
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN start from the live point

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN starting a live game 
AND the user has hide spoilers active
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN start the game from the broadcast start point (fallback to the beginning if the broadcast start point can’t be found)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN starting an archived game
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN start the game from the broadcast start point (fallback to the beginning if the broadcast start point can’t be found)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user resumes a game after backgrounding the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the game should resume from where the user was previously

title: Create Magic Link -> Account Exists (Automated)

title: Team View: Snapshot Schedule
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team view

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the snapshot is enabled
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see four tabs providing me game information for the team I am currently viewing

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN it is the first day of the season (the first day of Spring Training)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN tab 1 should be the first game and tab 2-4 are the next three games of the season

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN it is a day between the first and last day of the season
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN tab 1 should be yesterday's game(or the most recent game), tab 2 should be today's game (or the next upcoming game), and tabs 3-4 should be the games that follow the game in tab 2 on the schedule.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN it is the last day of the season
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN tab 4 should be the last game and tabs 1-3 are the previous three games of the season

title: Partner Product Links
custom_preconds: GIVEN a game in LIVE mode

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game is exclusively broadcast by Apple TV+
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN replace MLB.TV product link with Apple TV+

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game is exclusively broadcast by any other supported partner
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN replace MLB.TV product link with <Partner Name>

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN any of the partner links are tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN EPG will open and the behavior will be the same as tapping the game from epg

title: Hide Media Links when no media

"broadcasts": [],				
"dssMedia": {
"audio": [],
"mlbTv": []
}
custom_expected: THEN I will NOT see links to launch the media (Audio and MLB.tv)
